content.quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
content.author: Richard Dawkins

content.quote: He is one of those people who would be enormously improved by death.
content.author: H. H. Munro

content.quote: Human history becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.
content.author: H. G. Wells

content.quote: Against stupidity, the gods themselves contend in vain.
content.author: Friedrich von Schiller

content.quote: You may not be interested in war, but war is interested in you.
content.author: Leon Trotsky

content.quote: How wrong it is for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself.
content.author: Anais Nin

content.quote: In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
content.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

content.quote: Problems worthy of attack prove their worth by fighting back.
content.author: Paul Erdos

content.quote: The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds, and the pessimist fears this is true.
content.author: James Branch Cabell

content.quote: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
content.author: Albert Einstein
